title: Cabinet of the Philippines
text:
The Cabinet of the Philippines (, usually referred to as the Cabinet or Gabinete) consists of the heads of the largest part of the executive branch of the national government of the Philippines. Currently, it includes the secretaries of <a href="Executive%20departments%20of%20the%20Philippines">22 executive departments</a> and the heads of other several other minor agencies and offices that are subordinate to the <a href="president%20of%20the%20Philippines">president of the Philippines</a>.
The Cabinet secretaries are tasked to advise the President on the different affairs of the state like <a href="agriculture">agriculture</a>, <a href="budget">budget</a>, <a href="finance">finance</a>, <a href="education">education</a>, <a href="social%20welfare">social welfare</a>, <a href="National%20security">national defence</a>, <a href="foreign%20policy">foreign policy</a>, and the like.
They are nominated by the President and then presented to the <a href="Commission%20on%20Appointments%20%28Philippines%29">Commission on Appointments</a>, a body of the <a href="Congress%20of%20the%20Philippines">Congress of the Philippines</a> that confirms all appointments made by the <a href="President%20of%20the%20Philippines">head of state</a>, for confirmation or rejection. If the presidential appointees are approved, they are sworn into office, receive the title "Secretary", and begin to function their duties.
